contentList.content: A legendary artefact of Loviatar that appears more like a torture device than footwear. Its leather gleams with malice, promising unimaginable pain and pleasure.
Loviatar's Claws
Walk in Pain

Forced into a painful and slow walk, you receive a penalty of -[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> -2. You become tolerant to pain and receive <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> +2.
Pain Mirror

Any pain you experience can be amplified and channeled outwards to those around you. Any time you take damage, enemies within 15m of you suffer [1] or half damage if they succeed on a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Inviting Dance
<LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GOADING_ATTACK">Goad</LSTag> nearby creatures with a suggestive dance to attack you.
Dancing

Your dance Goads nearby creatures.

The song ends if you are incapacitated or loses concentration.
Must succeed a Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> every turn or be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GOADING_ATTACK">Goaded</LSTag> by the dance.
Remodelled Frame: Inception
Remodelled Frame: Foundation
Remodelled Frame: Maturation
Remodelled Frame: Perfection

Your body is starting to change in subtle ways. Your muscles soften and your flesh feels fuller in certain places. You receive <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> -1 and <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> +1.

Your body is noticeably changing. What you lost in your muscles seems to have gone to filling out your curves. You receive <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> -1 <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> -1 and <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> +2.

Your body is being moulded into the image of submission. Your previous muscles give way to supple curves. You receive <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> -2 <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> -1, <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> +3, and <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Intimidation <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.

Your body has been perfected as an image of submission. Your enticing curves and supple limbs would be more fitting in a bordello than out on an adventure. You receive <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> -2, <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> +4, <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Intimidation <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Persuasion Checks.
Remodelled en Pointe

Your remodelled body find it difficult to walk without proper heel support. With a shortened achilles tendon, you are forced to either crawl on your knees or stand on tip toes. You receive a penalty of -[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> -[2]

Your remodelled body find it almost impossible to walk without proper heel support. With a shortened achilles tendon, you are forced to stand on tip toes. You receive a penalty of -[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement speed</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> -[2], and receive <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Dexterity <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.

Due to your spectacular performance, the priest also gifts you a curious pair of boots. They seem to be made of some kind of leather, but they are so soft and supple that they feel like silk. You feel a strange urge to put them on...
You wake up, feeling that your body has subtly changed. Your muscles feels softer and your flesh feels fuller in certain places.
Your body feels more sensitive to touch. You feel a strange urge to join the frontline of the fiercest battle you can find.
Waking up, your body feels different yet again. You feel sluggish, and soft... Your muscles have shrunk, seemingly turned to fat in other places.
Again, you wake up to a softer body. Your full curves and supple limbs seem more appropriate for a bordella than a life on the road. You have now grown used to the grace of your new body.
